page.title: 02RUDGWICK-STREETS & HOUSING.
page.content: The{RESIDENTIAL}areas are grouped pri- marily around the{A281 HORSHAM-GUILD- {FORD}road and the{B2128.}The alignment of these{2}roads forms an inverted{T- shape. The head is the{A281}whilst the {JUNCTION}formed by the long, straight {B2128}road runs{NORTH}through{RUDGWICK to{CRANLEIGH.}This road is aptly named {CHURCH ST.}because of the{HOLY TRINITY {CHURCH}located at the top. Rudgwick is named after the Saxon{RIDGEWICK}-for a settlement on a ridge or hill.The head of Church St. culminates with a fairly steep gradient and once,the{P.O.,KINGS {HEAD PUB}and{CHURCH}produced the{FOCAL {POINT}in an essentially{RIBBON SETTLE- {MENT.}Church St.has many of the{ORIGI- {NAL}houses reflecting the{CHARACTER}of an old{RURAL}area. These once housed {ESTABLISHED FAMILIES}and enjoyed rural sounds but now they have to endure in- stead, rather noisy through traffic.
